Cerita Heroik di Balik Nyala Terang Listrik di Pedalaman Kalimantan
07 Nov 2019, 19:00 by Uji Sukma Medianti
Jakarta - Meski berada di perbatasan, namun warga pedalaman Krayan Nunukan, Kalimantan Utara juga punya hak yang sama sebagai warga negara. Salah satunya mendapatkan pasokan listrik yang memadai.
Pemerintah Presiden Joko Widodo melalui megaproyek pembangkit listrik 35.000 MW di periode pertamanya berkomitmen untuk melistriki kawasan tertinggal, terdepan dan terluar (3T) di Indonesia.
Ditemui tim detikcom di Kantor Unit Layanan PLN Krayan, Junior Operasi Pembangkit Unit Layanan Krayan Mochamad Fadel mengatakan membangun jaringan listrik di Krayan memang tidak mudah. Selain karena letaknya di perbatasan negara, akses yang harus ditempuh jadi tantangan berat yang harus dilalui.
Di kantor yang juga merupakan tempat Pembangkit Listrik Tenaga Diesel (PLTD) dioperasikan itu Fadel bercerita untuk menerangi Krayan ada tiga buah mesin diesel yang jadi pembangkit listrik. Mesin ini dulunya diangkut menggunakan tronton melalui Malaysia.
Maklum, jarak dari Long Bawan, ibu kota kecamatan Krayan, menuju Perbatasan Malaysia yakni Long Midang hanya 10,8 kilometer saja. Sedangkan untuk menuju Krayan harus melalui Nunukan masuk ke Malinau. Jaraknya mencapai 108 kilometer. Namun, permasalahannya bukanlah jarak melainkan akses.
Jika menggunakan jalur darat lewat Malinau, menempuh Krayan memerlukan waktu tiga minggu. Apalagi bila membawa material barang-barang besar, harus menggunakan alat berat. Alhasil menempuh Krayan melalui Malaysia adalah jalan satu-satunya yang dapat dipilih.


Tiga Mesin Pembangkit Tenaga Diesel di Krayan Induk Foto: Pradita Utama

"Mesin ini diangkut lewat Sei Menggaris. Lalu dibawa ke Nunukan dulu. Terus nyebrang ke Malaysia lewat Tawau. Sesampainya di Tawau mereka lewat jalur darat. Jalur (darat)-nya itu dari Tawau ke Lahad Datu terus ke Sabah terus ke Lawas terus ke Ba'kelalan terus masuk Indonesia lewat Long Midang," terangnya beberapa waktu lalu.
Begitupun dengan tiang-tiangnya, semua diangkut melalui jalur darat lewat Malaysia. Fadel menyebut ada 267 tiang yang didirikan untuk membangun jaringan dari PLTD Long Kiwan, Krayan Barat sampai ke Pa'Betung, Krayan Timur.
Sedangkan untuk Long Bawan, Krayan Induk sampai ke perbatasan Long Midang jumlah tiangnya ada 170 termasuk tiang Jaringan Tegangan Rendah (JTR).
"Kalau tiang dipasang oleh vendor (pihak ketiga). Untuk pemasangan tiang ke Long Midang dikerjakan delapan orang pekerja. Jadi pertama kali tiang itu datang, langsung dirikan tiang sama aksesori sampai ke rencana lokasi PLBN (Pos Lintas Batas Negara) Long Midang itu terpasang," jelas Fadel.
"Dari tiang yang paling tinggi kira-kira jaraknya 8 kilometer. Saya berdua pegawai PLN yang lain mengawasi pemasangan, mengecek tiang ini bagus atau engga, terus miring apa engga juga menjamin keselamatan K3 pekerja," tambahnya.
Fadel menjelaskan saat ini kebutuhan listrik di wilayah Krayan jumlahnya mencapai 240 kiloWatt (kW) yang mana setiap pelanggan memasang daya listrik sebesar 2 ampere atau setara 450 watt. Dengan tiga buah mesin diesel terpasang di PLTD Krayan, kapasitas yang terbaca jumlahnya mencapai 450 kW dengan asumsi performa mesin 100%.
Saat ini, tiga buah mesin milik PLN itu mampu menerangi 35 desa di Krayan. Masyarakat pun dapat menikmati listrik hingga larut malam. Anak-anak sekolah juga dapat belajar dan membaca buku dengan leluasa tanpa khawatir kehabisan solar di malam hari. Perekonomian warga Krayan juga berubah seiring dengan dibukanya warung-warung serta kafe pada malam hari.
Selain itu, dengan dibangunnya Jalan Trans Kalimantan dari perbatasan Malaysia tepatnya di Long Midang sampai ke Malinau, diharapkan mulai 2020 hingga 2023 bisa dilakukan perluasan jaringan listrik sesuai dengan kapasitas mesin yang ada di Long Bawan, Krayan.
Ditemui dalam kesempatan terpisah, Pelaksana Tugas (Plt) Manager ULP Nunukan Rachmad Adi Widodo mengatakan saat ini daya tersambung yang ada di Kabupaten Nunukan ada 53,51 MVA dengan jumlah pelanggan sebanyak 34.059 KK.
"Kabupaten Nunukan terdiri dari 19 kecamatan, dengan daya mampu mencapai 13.500 kilowatt (kW) dengan beban puncak 12.525 kW," kata Rachmad.
Saat ini, Nunukan memiliki 13 pembangkit yang terbagi di tujuh wilayah. Di antaranya Tulin Onsoi, Sebuku, Sei Menggaris, Sei Limau, Sebatik, Krayan Induk dan Krayan Selatan.

The Heroic Story Behind the Electric Light in the Interior of Kalimantan
07 Nov 2019, 19:00 by Sukma Medianti Test
Jakarta - Despite being at the border, inland residents of Krayan Nunukan, North Kalimantan also have the same rights as citizens. One of them is getting an adequate electricity supply.
President Joko Widodo's government through its 35,000 MW power plant megaproject in its first period committed to electrifying underdeveloped, leading and outermost (3T) areas in Indonesia.
When met by the AFP team at the Krayan PLN Service Unit Office, Krayan Junior Service Unit Power Generation Unit Mochamad Fadel said that building an electricity network in Krayan was indeed not easy. Apart from being located on the country's borders, access that must be taken becomes a formidable challenge that must be passed.
In the office which is also the place for the Diesel Power Plant (PLTD) to operate, Fadel told me to light up Krayan, there are three diesel engines that become power plants. This machine was once transported using a tronton via Malaysia.
Understandably, the distance from Long Bawan, capital of the Krayan district, to the Malaysian Border namely Long Midang is only 10.8 kilometers away. Meanwhile, to get to Krayan you have to go through Nunukan to enter Malinau. The distance reaches 108 kilometers. However, the problem is not distance but access.
If using the land route via Malinau, taking Krayan takes three weeks. Especially when carrying large items of material, must use heavy equipment. As a result, taking Krayan through Malaysia is the only way to choose.


Three Diesel Power Generators in Krayan Main Photo: Pradita Utama

"This machine was transported through Sei Penggaris. Then it was taken to Nunukan first. Then crossed to Malaysia via Tawau. Arriving in Tawau they went by land. The (land) route was from Tawau to Lahad Datu then on Sabah then Lawas then Ba Baum "They will continue to enter Indonesia through Long Midang," he explained some time ago.
Likewise with the pillars, all transported by land via Malaysia. Fadel said there were 267 poles erected to build networks from the Long Kiwan PLTD, West Krayan to Pa'Betung, East Krayan.
Whereas for Long Bawan, Krayan Main up to the Long Midang border there are 170 poles including the Low Voltage Network (JTR) pole.
"If the poles are installed by vendors (third parties). For the installation of poles to Long Midang, eight workers will be employed. So the first time the poles come, build the poles and accessories directly up to the planned location of the Long Midang PLBN (Post-State Border) post. "explained Fadel.
"From the tallest pole, the distance is about 8 kilometers. I and the other PLN employees are supervising the installation, checking whether the pole is good or not, keep on tilting whether it also guarantees the safety of K3 workers," he added.
Fadel explained that the current electricity demand in the Krayan region is 240 kilowatt (kW), where each customer installs 2 amperes of electricity or equal to 450 watts. With three diesel engines installed in the Krayan PLTD, the total read capacity reaches 450 kW assuming 100% engine performance.
At present, the three PLN-owned machines are capable of lighting up 35 villages in Krayan. The community can enjoy electricity until late at night. School children can also study and read books freely without worrying about running out of diesel at night. The economy of Krayan residents also changes with the opening of stalls and cafes at night.
In addition, with the construction of the Trans Kalimantan Road from the Malaysian border in Long Midang to Malinau, it is expected that from 2020 to 2023 the expansion of the electricity network can be carried out in accordance with the existing engine capacity in Long Bawan, Krayan.
When met on a separate occasion, the Acting Manager (Acting) of the ULP Nunukan Manager Rachmad Adi Widodo said that currently there are 53.51 MVA connected power in the Nunukan Regency with a total customer number of 34.059 households.
"Nunukan Regency consists of 19 districts, with a power capable of reaching 13,500 kilowatts (kW) with a peak load of 12,525 kW," Rachmad said.
At present, Nunukan has 13 generators which are divided into seven regions. Among them Tulin Onsoi, Sebuku, Sei Penggaris, Sei Limau, Sebatik, Krayan Main and Krayan Selatan.
